Entry.Title: Brexit - LIVE: Government publishes tranche of documents on no-deal 'risks', including roaming charges and driving licences
Entry.Description: Follow all the latest updates from Westminster here

Entry.Title: Madeleine McCann: Detectives 'ask UK government for six months' further funding for investigation'
Entry.Description: Funding for Scotland Yard's Operation Raptor due to run out at end of month

Entry.Title: M5 crash: Motorway closed after two killed and four injured as lorry and cars collide
Entry.Description: Lengthy delays after fatal accident on one of UK's busiest motorways

Entry.Title: Salisbury attack: Russian novichok suspects deny involvement in poisoning, insisting they were in town to see 'famous' cathedral
Entry.Description: It was all about Salisbury Cathedral's 123-m spire, the suspects claim in comments that border on the absurd.

Entry.Title: Conservatives condemned by British Jewish leaders after MEPs vote to defend Hungary's far-right Orban government
Entry.Description: The organisation has said the Conservative support for Mr Orban's authoritarian regime is 'very concerning'

Entry.Title: UK mass surveillance programme violates human rights, European court rules
Entry.Description: Liberty hails 'major victory for the rights and freedom of people'

Entry.Title: Abortion clinic 'buffer zones' plan to stop protesters rejected by the government in surprise move
Entry.Description: Former Home Secretary Amber Rudd said it was 'unacceptable' that anyone should feel intimidated at an abortion clinic

Entry.Title: Yom Kippur 2018: What you need to know about the holiest day of the Jewish year
Entry.Description: Day of Atonement closes Ten Days of Repentance after Rosh Hashanah

Entry.Title: HMP Bedford: UK Prison watchdog issues fourth 'urgent notice' on jail in space of nine months
Entry.Description: Ministers told to take urgent action after inspectors warn 'there could all too easily be complete breakdown in order and discipline' in jail

Entry.Title: Number of white people arrested for terror offences outstrip any other single ethnic group, new figures show
Entry.Description: Number of terror arrests falls by 22% overall but police say there has been no decrease in threat

Entry.Title: Tories were only governing conservative party in western Europe to support Hungarian far-right in EU vote
Entry.Description: Theresa May's MEPs isolated amongst conservatives amid claims of trading favours for support on Brexit

Entry.Title: Mobile roaming charges would be 'limited' in event of no-deal Brexit, government insists
Entry.Description: But minister stops short of committing to full ban on reintroduction of fees for Britons using their devices in Europe

Entry.Title: Brexit: Theresa May suffers eighth resignation over her negotiating strategy
Entry.Description: Robert Courts was a ministerial aid at the Foreign Office before quitting

Entry.Title: Teenagers celebrated after frenzied fatal knife attack on 19-year-old who gate-crashed London birthday party, court hears
Entry.Description: Six boys face charges for murder of Lewis Blackman, who was stabbed 14 times in February

Entry.Title: No-deal Brexit would bring 'risks and disruption' with 'delays for businesses', admits Dominic Raab
Entry.Description: Brexit secretary talks of 'contraflow systems on the M20' - appearing to confirm plans for lorries to be parked for many miles en route to Dover

Entry.Title: 'Without your rights I can't have my rights': Dawn Butler on the importance of intersectionality at the UK's first transgender conference
Entry.Description: 'We have to fight for each other,' Labour's shadow secretary of state for women and equalities says

Entry.Title: 'Outdated' UK abortion laws hampering care for women, doctors say
Entry.Description: Study finds threat of prosecution makes doctors less likely to go into abortion provision

Entry.Title: Conservative MEPs to protect Hungary's far-right Orban government from EU sanctions in vote
Entry.Description: Labour says decision to shield government is 'disgraceful'

Entry.Title: World 'sleepwalking' towards another financial crisis, Gordon Brown warns
Entry.Description: Former prime minister says world is currently 'leaderless' and has not learnt lessons from 2008

Entry.Title: Diane Abbott to dismiss Theresa May's 'arbitrary' immigration targets in major speech

Entry.Title: Tony Blair calls for greater focus on prevention strategy in fight against terrorism
Entry.Description: Former prime minister says international community needs to reform education globally in order to root out religious prejudice

Entry.Title: Isis threat to UK remains despite terror group's demise in Middle East, warns commander
Entry.Description: Operation now underway to reclaim Hajin, the last area remaining under militants' control

Entry.Title: Tory cuts leave alcohol addiction services at breaking point warns Labour, as figures show record low in treatment
Entry.Description: Number of people in treatment at lowest level for a decade despite year-on-year growth in those dealing with alcohol addiction, research shows

Entry.Title: Prison sentences doubled for people who attack emergency service workers under new law
Entry.Description: More than 26,000 assaults against police officers in England and Wales and 17,000 on NHS staff recorded in past year

Entry.Title: Paedophiles viewing child sex abuse images once every 23 minutes in England and Wales as crimes rocket
Entry.Description: Calls for alternatives to prosecuting paedophiles as police 'reach saturation point'

Entry.Title: Tory MP names 30 Russians linked to 'murder' amid criticism of government for failing to sanction them
Entry.Description: Former ministers and officials have all been targeted in other countries over death of Sergei Magnitsky, but not in the UK – despite passing of legislation four months ago

Entry.Title: Grenfell fire survivors and bereaved to help to decide 'most fitting' tribute after new memorial commission announced
Entry.Description: Proposals range from garden to black sculpture that would loom over west London skyline

Entry.Title: Conservatives accused of seeking Brexit favours after backing Hungary's authoritarian leader Viktor Orban
Entry.Description: Two Conservative MEPs refused to go along with the rest of the Conservative group and lend a supportive vote to Mr Orban

Entry.Title: Islington suspicious package: Scores of homes evacuated over 'suspected suicide vest' that turns out to be bin bag
Entry.Description: Several officers were seen remonstrating at the scene with a man who they accused of wasting police time

Entry.Title: Police officer squeezed woman's breast after drinking 16 pints of lager during work day trip
Entry.Description: Constable guilty of gross misconduct after touching woman while 'three-quarters of the way to absolutely wasted'

Entry.Title: Jacob Rees-Mogg says he's not interested in any 'accidental' toppling of prime ministers, but we know better
Entry.Description: The ERG set out its second bit of 'research' in as many days, but the only research that counts is the stuff on how to get rid of Theresa May

Entry.Title: Parliamentary authorities launch investigation into Jeremy Corbyn aide over security clearance claims
Entry.Description: 'Visitors passes are for visitors only. They cannot be used to carry out work on the parliamentary estate'

Entry.Title: Brexiteers call for end to leadership challenge talk as splits open among eurosceptic Tories
Entry.Description: The day had started with talk of an imminent 'coup' against the prime minister

Entry.Title: Crocodile and 35 snakes found in man's bedroom in Essex
Entry.Description: Lee Thompson to be sentenced after being on the run for keeping the animals without a license

Entry.Title: The Teacher's Pet to Serial: Eight of the best true crime podcasts
Entry.Description: Widely popular form often raises profile of abandoned cases, despite occasionally being criticised for insensitivity and amateurism

Entry.Title: Many voice assistant users have 'trust issues' with their device, study claims
Entry.Description: Nearly half of people believe technology is always listening to them

Entry.Title: Salisbury novichok attack: Russian spies smuggled chemical weapons through airport baggage checks, UK security minister admits
Entry.Description: Ben Wallace says novichok used against Sergei Skripal had potential to kill 'hundreds of people'

Entry.Title: PMQs - as it happened: Corbyn says May 'pouring petrol on burning injustices' with universal credit rollout
Entry.Description: Updates from Westminster, as they happened

Entry.Title: Labour's Tom Watson 'reversed' type-2 diabetes through diet and exercise
Entry.Description: 'One of the most important ingredients for political success is, quite simply, staying alive,' says MP

Entry.Title: Michael Gove sparks anger after appearing to backtrack over post-Brexit live animal export ban
Entry.Description: Caroline Lucas accuses government of delivering Brexit 'built on lies'

Entry.Title: 'Green Brexit' bill to see farmers paid for adapting to environmentally-friendly measures
Entry.Description: Government plan will phase out current system of subsidies paid for amount of land farmed

Entry.Title: Tom Watson suggests Labour's general secretary should quit if antisemitism row not dealt with by Christmas
Entry.Description: 'She has been in post for three or four months. If I come here against at Christmas and she has not dealt with it then you may be asking me why she is still in post'

Entry.Title: Conservatives back far-right government of Viktor Orban in crunch vote in European Parliament
Entry.Description: The Hungarian leader arrived in Strasbourg demanding a fair Brexit deal for Theresa May's government

Entry.Title: British man killed in Costa del Sol after shootout with Spanish police
Entry.Description: Thirty-nine-year-old from Leeds had history of drug trafficking and weapons possession, police say

Entry.Title: Pro-Brexit Tories admit 'nothing new' in their proposals to solve Irish border controversy
Entry.Description: David Davis acknowledges ideas are return to 'max fac' plan dumped by the prime minister – after a warning it would cost businesses £20bn a year

Entry.Title: Jacob Rees-Mogg protester tells Brexiteer's children: 'Lots of people don't like your daddy, do you know that?'
Entry.Description: Activists confront Conservative MP over pay of family's long-time nanny

Entry.Title: Man who strangled his mother to death when she told him to move out is jailed for life
Entry.Description: Majid Butt says attack happened in 'moment of madness'

Entry.Title: Brexit: EU can 'certainly not' accept Theresa May's single market plan, Juncker warns
Entry.Description: EU president says Chequers proposals can be a 'starting point'

Entry.Title: Salisbury attack: Vladimir Putin says Russia knows real identities of novichok poisoning suspects
Entry.Description: 'We have found them. There is nothing special or criminal about it, I can assure you,' says president
